definition: see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure

sentences.english: However, you should feel that it isnot your responsibility to take on this stress.
sentences.chinese: 不過，你應該明白自己並沒有義務去揹負這種重壓。

sentences.english: The hands on the office clock seemed to be weighted down.
sentences.chinese: 辦公室裏鐘的指針好像加了重壓一樣。

sentences.english: The branch cracked under the weight of the snow.
sentences.chinese: 樹枝在雪的重壓下啪地一聲折斷了。

sentences.english: But it would weigh on consumer demand all the same.
sentences.chinese: 但是這同樣會對消費者需求產生重壓。

sentences.english: When the world to seed weight, it will break out in their own way.
sentences.chinese: 當世界給草籽重壓時，它總會用自己的方法破土而出。

sentences.english: The bridge at Medicine Bow is shaky, and would not bear the weight of the train.
sentences.chinese: 梅迪西彎的大橋已經在搖晃，經受不起火車的重壓了。

sentences.english: I have suggested palliatives for the change-pressed individual.
sentences.chinese: 我爲深受變化重壓之苦的個人提供幾劑良藥。

sentences.english: The ground gave in under the weight of the heavy car.
sentences.chinese: 地面在沉重的汽車的重壓下塌陷了。

sentences.english: Under the weight of these heavy manners, let the power fall.
sentences.chinese: 受夠了那些沉甸甸的重壓，打倒當權派。

sentences.english: Under stress, this time, Europe did not splinter.
sentences.chinese: 此次，重壓之下的歐洲並未出現四分五裂的局面。

sentences.english: Stand firm together. Do not bow to pressure.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們堅定立場，不要屈服於重壓。

sentences.english: The lead pipe has turned from pressure.
Under heavy stress, the steel frame was strained.
sentences.chinese: 在重壓下，鋼架都變形了。

sentences.english: When the world to seed weight, it will use their own methods and sprouting.
sentences.chinese: 當世界給草籽重壓時，它總會用自己的方法破土而出。

sentences.english: Both bore languidly the indefinable burden of immaterial pleasures.
sentences.chinese: 他倆昏昏沉沉地承受着這種非物質的快感的無限重壓。

sentences.english: If the engineer miscalculates, the structure may collapse under the pressure.
sentences.chinese: 工程師若不慎算錯，整座橋樑就會在重壓之下倒塌。

definition: to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
to turn a blind eye to
